intro: Trachyandra sabulosa, commonly known as the sand trachyandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Trachyandra sabulosa is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal dunes, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
